channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023100912
item.description:
Report E-2023100912

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 19, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2014 was damaged in transit and released approximately 275-gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all free-standing product and previously deployed absorbents from the trailer floor into five (5) 55-gallon open top drums. HCE personnel utilized a forklift to perform a gravity transfer of the remaining UN2014 in the tote into one (1) additional 55-gallon open top drum. All UN2014-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. The impacted wood pallets were staged on site along with the seven (7) previously generated 55-gallon drums for further management.

item.title: Report E-2023100860
item.description:
Report E-2023100860

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2023, at 1505 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of SODIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLID (UN1823, 8, II) from (1) 50-lb poly bag. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by a forklift puncture during offloading and contained to a 1’ x 1’ area on the dock floor. The release was cleaned with hand tools and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum and staged onsite by contractors in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100207
item.description:
Report X-2023100207

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-23
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking right next to bank 3's scan tunnel in the RORS Unload. Management called on the radio indicating a Damaged HazMat near bank 3. Package had Flammable Liquid labeling and was determined to be a Fully Regulated HazMat. Package was immediately put in a plastic bag to prevent contamination and was taken out of the unload and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 glass bottles inside had its cap come completely loose and had no safety seal underneath. This led to a leak of Hazardous Materials. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023100202
item.description:
Report X-2023100202

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and also emitting a visible gas on door 65 in load 6 of the RORS Unload. Package was taken by QA personnel out of the load area and was isolated from the rest of the staff. Package had a powerful odor, vapor and liquid leaking out of it. Package had Fully Regulated HazMat labeling Corrosive) and was determined to be a HazMat. The package was put in a plastic bin to prevent it from melting through the metal/cardboard. The item was also put next to a vent in the HazMat Cage to prevent inhalation. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles of Hydrochloric Acid had a loose cap, which allowed for the acid to leak out, this caused a chemical reaction that destroyed the box, and also rusted the metal plate on door 65 that it was placed on. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in plastic hazmat bag in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081359
item.description:
Report X-2023081359

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A package containing a 1L can of UN1268 was discovered at the ORDR location. The outer packaging was a Fedex envelope that had torn open to reveal the contents. There were no markings/paperwork on the outer packaging indicating that it was hazardous material. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package are being held for the FAA.
